meanings.definition: The quality or state of being denumerable.
meanings.sent1: The denumerabilities of the objects in the collection made it easy to organize.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study the denumerabilities of sets to understand their properties.
meanings.sent3: The denumerabilities of the puzzle pieces made it fun to put together.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like the denumerabilities of a well-organized library.
meanings.sent5: The denumerabilities of the stars in the sky were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The property of being countable or enumerable.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the denumerabilities of the items in stock helped with inventory management.
meanings.sent2: In computer science, programmers deal with the denumerabilities of data structures.
meanings.sent3: The denumerabilities of the ingredients in the recipe made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent4: The denumerabilities of the audience's laughter filled the theater.
meanings.sent5: The denumerabilities of the colors in the painting created a harmonious composition.
